intro: Taraxacum laiense, commonly known as the Laiense dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and a hollow, leafless stem that supports a flower head. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that develop into fluffy white seed heads, typical of the dandelion genus. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in open, disturbed soils. Taraxacum laiense is noted for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
